intro: Origanum laevigatum, commonly known as lemon thyme, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its fragrant, lemon-scented leaves and small, pale pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Its aromatic leaves are often used in cooking and traditional medicine. Origanum laevigatum is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
